name: Scorpion Assassin

trait.name: Assassinate
text: During its first turn, the assassin has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the assassin scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Evasion
text: If the scorpion assassin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the assassin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
text: Once per turn, the scorpion assassin deals an extra 17 (5d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the assassin that isn't incapacitated and the assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Spellcasting
text: The scorpion assassin is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The scorpion assassin has the following spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): guidance, light, mending, thaumaturgy
• 1st level (4 slots): bane, command, inflict wounds, shield of faith
• 2nd level (3 slots): blindness/deafness, hold person, silence
• 3rd level (2 slots): bestow curse, meld into stone

action.name: Multiattack
text: The scorpion assassin makes two scorpion stiletto attacks.

action.name: Scorpion Stiletto
text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d4 + 5) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 24 (7d6) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. On a success, the target takes half the damage and isn't poisoned.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
text: When an attacker the scorpion assassin can see hits it with an attack, it can choose to take half the damage instead.

spells: guidance, light, mending, thaumaturgy, bane, command, inflict wounds, shield of faith, blindness/deafness, hold person, silence, bestow curse, meld into stone
